intro: Aspilia silphioides f. aristata, commonly known as the aristate aspilia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its horticultural appeal lies in its distinctive, upright growth habit and showy inflorescences. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and adaptability to well-drained soils.
